{{infobox character | people=[[Edain|Adan]] | name=Baragund | image= | caption= | pronun= | othernames= | titles= | position= | location= | affiliation=[[Barahir's outlaws]] | language= | birth={{FA|420}} | birthlocation= | rule= | death={{FA|460}} | deathlocation=[[Tarn Aeluin]] | age=40 | notablefor= | house=[[House of Bëor]] | parentage=[[Bregolas]] | siblings=[[Beleth]] and [[Belegund]] | spouse= | children=[[Morwen]] | gender=Male | height= | hair= | eyes= | clothing= | weapons= | steed= }} '''Baragund''' ({{FA|420}}-{{FA|460|n}}) was a descendant of [[Bëor]], and one of [[Barahir]]'s [[Barahir's outlaws|twelve followers]]. == History == Baragund was the son of [[Bregolas]]. He had only one daughter, [[Morwen]], with an unnamed wife.{{WJ|14}}, ''(i) House of Bëor'', p. 231 Baragund and his brother Belegund partook in the [[Dagor Bragollach]] under the command of their uncle [[Barahir]]. They survived, but were beaten back.{{S|Fingolfin}} With Barahir and ten others, they formed a small band and lived as [[Bëorings|outlaws]] in [[Dorthonion]], near [[Tarn Aeluin]]. They lived in hiding for some time, until [[Morgoth]]'s agents captured [[Gorlim]] and coerced him into giving the location of their hideaway. [[Orcs]] were sent to raid it, and succeeded. Baragund and the outlaws were killed. Only [[Beren]] survived, as he had been away on an errand.{{S|Beren}} ==Etymology== The full meaning of ''Baragund'' is unknown. The first element is said to consist of the [[Noldorin|Exilic Noldorin]] word ''[[bara]]'' ("fiery, eager").{{LR|Etymologies}}, p. 351 The second element could perhaps be ''gund'' (cf. [[Felagund#Etymology|Felagund]]). == Genealogy == {{familytree/start}} {{familytree | | | | | | | | | BRE | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | | |BRE=[[Bregor]]
